com.jayway.restassured.config

Class DecoderConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jayway.restassured.config.DecoderConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Config

    public class DecoderConfig
extends Object
implements Config
    Allows you to specify configuration for the decoder.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • DecoderConfig

        public DecoderConfig()
        Configure the decoder config to use the default charset as specified by Charset.defaultCharset() for content decoding.

      • DecoderConfig

        public DecoderConfig(String defaultContentCharset)
        Configure the decoder config to use supplied defaultContentCharset for content decoding if a charset is not specified in the response.
        Parameters:
        defaultContentCharset - The charset to use if not specifically specified in the response.

      • DecoderConfig

        public DecoderConfig(DecoderConfig.ContentDecoder contentDecoder,
                     DecoderConfig.ContentDecoder... additionalContentDecoders)
        Configure the decoder config to use Charset.defaultCharset() for content decoding. Also specify the content decoders that will be presented to the server when making a request (using the Accept-Encoding header). If the server supports any of these encodings then REST Assured will automatically perform decoding of the response accordingly.

        By default DecoderConfig.ContentDecoder.GZIP and DecoderConfig.ContentDecoder.DEFLATE are used.

        Parameters:
        contentDecoder - The first content decoder
        additionalContentDecoders - Optional additional content decoders

    • Method Detail

      • defaultContentCharset

        public String defaultContentCharset()
        Returns:
        The configured default content charset that'll be used by REST Assured if no charset is specified in the response.

      • contentDecoders

        public List<DecoderConfig.ContentDecoder> contentDecoders()
        Returns:
        The configured content decoders.

      • useNoWrapForInflateDecoding

        public DecoderConfig useNoWrapForInflateDecoding(boolean nowrap)
        If the parameter 'nowrap' is true then the ZLIB header and checksum fields will not be used. This provides compatibility with the compression format used by both GZIP and PKZIP.

        Note: When using the 'nowrap' option it is also necessary to provide an extra "dummy" byte as input. This is required by the ZLIB native library in order to support certain optimizations.

        Setting no wrap to true is required when communicating with servers not using RFC 1950 (such as PHP which uses RFC 1951). See stackoverflow for more details.

        Default is .

        Parameters:
        nowrap - if true then support GZIP compatible compression
        Returns:
        A new instance of the DecoderConfig.

      • shouldUseNoWrapForInflateDecoding

        public boolean shouldUseNoWrapForInflateDecoding()
        Returns:
        true if no wrap should be used for inflate encoded streams.
        See Also:
        useNoWrapForInflateDecoding(boolean)

      • defaultContentCharset

        public DecoderConfig defaultContentCharset(String charset)
        Specify the default charset of the content in the response that's assumed if no charset is explicitly specified in the response.
        Parameters:
        charset - The expected charset
        Returns:
        A new instance of the DecoderConfig.

      • defaultContentCharset

        public DecoderConfig defaultContentCharset(Charset charset)
        Specify the default charset of the content in the response that's assumed if no charset is explicitly specified in the response.
        Parameters:
        charset - The expected charset
        Returns:
        A new instance of the DecoderConfig.

      • contentDecoders

        public DecoderConfig contentDecoders(DecoderConfig.ContentDecoder contentDecoder,
                                     DecoderConfig.ContentDecoder... additionalContentDecoders)
        Specify the content decoders that will be presented to the server when making a request (using the Accept-Encoding header). If the server supports any of these encodings then REST Assured will automatically perform decoding of the response accordingly.

        By default DecoderConfig.ContentDecoder.GZIP and DecoderConfig.ContentDecoder.DEFLATE are used.

        Parameters:
        contentDecoder - The first content decoder
        additionalContentDecoders - Optional additional content decoders
        Returns:
        A new instance of the DecoderConfig.

      • noContentDecoders

        public DecoderConfig noContentDecoders()
        Specify that no content decoders should be used by REST Assured.
        Returns:
        A new instance of the DecoderConfig.
        See Also:
        contentDecoders(com.jayway.restassured.config.DecoderConfig.ContentDecoder, com.jayway.restassured.config.DecoderConfig.ContentDecoder...)

      • decoderConfig

        public static DecoderConfig decoderConfig()
        Returns:
        A static way to create a new DecoderConfig instance without calling "new" explicitly. Mainly for syntactic sugar.

      • and

        public DecoderConfig and()
        Syntactic sugar.
        Returns:

      • isUserConfigured

        public boolean isUserConfigured()
        Specified by:
        isUserConfigured in interface Config
        Returns:
        true if this config instance has been explicitly configured by the user, false if it has the default values.
